source.0a489a86:
target_terms_stemmed(targs)
base_path = "/kaggle/input/CORD-19-research-challenge/"
sources = pd.read_csv(base_path + "metadata.csv",
                     dtype={"pubmed_id":str,
                            "arvix_id":str,
                           "Microsoft Academic Paper ID":str})
# arxiv added chgs - if no doi use url for arxiv, if not journal use arxiv for arxiv
filt = ( (sources.source_x=='arxiv') & (sources.arxiv_id.notnull()) & (sources.url.notnull()) & (sources.doi.isnull()) )
sources.loc[filt , 'doi' ] = sources[filt]['url']
sources.doi = sources.doi.fillna('').apply(doi_url)   
filt = ((sources.source_x=='arxiv') & (sources.arxiv_id.notnull()) & (sources.journal.isnull()) )
sources.loc[filt , 'journal' ] = '(arxiv)'

pmc_valid_ids = set(sources[(sources["has_pmc_xml_parse"]==True) & (sources['pmcid'].notnull() ) ] ["pmcid"].unique().tolist())
pdf_valid_ids = set(sources[(sources["has_pdf_parse"]==True) & (sources.has_pmc_xml_parse==False) & (sources['sha'].notnull() ) ] ["sha"].unique().tolist())


osdir = '/kaggle/input'                   
json_files_from_directory(osdir,pmc_valid_ids, pdf_valid_ids, targs, sources, testing=False ) # testing=True will break on 1000 

htmls_topics_create(targs)

source.e97749db:
There may be additional topics tags to what were used in this notebook that will help to keep abreast of what is in the research.
As the COVID-19 Open Research dataset is updated, the notebook can be edited and committed. Papers are not always peer-reviewed in this area, but getting information as soon as possible in publications may be helpful.

As data becomes available incorporating here may be useful for presentation and other analysis.

#
COVID-19 What do we know about virus genetics, origin, and evolution?
